summary: Over 869,000 people and over 91,000 truck, rail, and sea containers entered the U.S. every day in FY 2022 through 328 U.S. ports of entry. U.S. Customs and Border Protection uses 2 public-private partnership programs to augment its port services. One allows partners such as port authorities to reimburse CBP for additional work outside regular hours. Another accepts donations for infrastructure improvements, which could speed...
title: U.S. Ports of Entry: Update on CBP Public-Private Partnerships
